title: Linux Commands
description: Learning simple and advanced Linux commands by examples.

courses.title: Lesson 1
courses.description: What is the shell. Commands and options. Navigating and exploring the system.

courses.title: Lesson 2
courses.description: Manipulating files and directories. Commands about comands. Command history and keyboard tricks.

courses.title: Lesson 3
courses.description: Users and groups, permissions. Processes and signal.

courses.title: Lesson 4
courses.description: Redirecting input/output of the command to and from files. Connecting multiple commands together into powerful pipelines.

courses.title: Lesson 5
courses.description: Shell expansions and shell quotes. The shell environment. Customizing the prompt.

courses.title: Lesson 6
courses.description: Searching for files (locate, find). Regular expressions (grep).

courses.title: Lesson 7
courses.description: Text processing (cat, sort, uniq, cut, paste, join, diff, tr, sed).

courses.title: Lesson 10
courses.description: Starting with bash scripts. Variables, constants, functions

courses.title: Lesson 12
courses.description: Looping with while and until. Branching with 'case'. Positional parameters.

courses.title: Lesson 13
courses.description: Looping with 'for'. Parameter expansion. Arithmetic evaluation and expansion.

courses.title: Lesson 14
courses.description: Arrays. Group commands. Subshell. Process substitution. Traps. Asynchronous execution. Named pipes.
